resources.string: C
Hello blank fragment
Coding will start from section 3

As you might have read in the bottom navigation plate that this section is for code but since we have only done the introduction part so we will begin coding from the 3rd section, since the next section will also going to be mainly about setting up the editor, environment for working in C.
PROCEED TO NEXT SECTION
1. Write and Execute a program that prints your name.
2. Write and execute a program to print the sum of 10 and 5.
3. Write and execute a program that prints your name and your school name.
4. Write a program that prints the product of 10 and 2500 and prints like \"2500*10 = \'solution\' \"

NOTE - Some of these program might be more understandable to you after you go through the next section, so if you don\'t get these program now don\'t worry in the next section you will understand then you can go through these again :).
1.W and E a program to show the use of float, int and char data types.
2.Write a program to store 37,98.7, \'3\', \'A\' inside different data types and then print them in separate lines.
3.Write and execute a program to add 2 numbers 23 and 33.456 by storing them in their correct data types then printing the output as an integer value(without decimal places).
1. Write and execute a program to print a float value without points/decimal places.
2. Write a program to take 2 integer inputs and print the total of those values.
3. Write and Execute a program like we did above by taking 2 numbers as input but this time perform subtraction,division and multiplication also.
1. Write a program to check that the given number is positive or negative.
2.Write and Execute a program to reverse a 2 digit int value.

3.W and E a program that checks whether the given number is the square of any number between 2 and 7 or not,If its a square of the number from 2 and 7 print YES otherwise print NO .\n
for ex - input number = 25\n \t output - YES.

4. Write and Execute a program that prints the number(between 1 and 8) taken as input from the user in words.
 For example-:
 	input - 7
 	output - SEVEN.

Note -: in many questions you might have a better way of solving them than what is done or shown in the examples so go on try your method if it works its nice, since there can be many ways to solve a problem.
1. Write and Execute a program that prints the table of 19 using for loop.
2. Write a program that takes two values from the user a and b and prints the values from a to b.

3. Write and Execute a program that prints the table of 25 but only for the odd places or values.
 for example -:
 	25x1 = 25
 go to the next odd place i.e. 3
 25 x 3 = 75
4. Write a program that prints all the even numbers between 0 and 51 using while loop.
1. Write and Execute a program that reverses the given int number.

2. Write and Execute a program that prints the words for number between 1 and 5 inserted by user by using the switch case.
 for ex - : 
	 input = 1
	 output = ONE
3. Write and Execute a program that checks whether a number is divisible by 5 and then checks that if its even or odd with the use of nested if-else.

4. W and E a program to build a calculator that inputs 2 number from user and then give the user choice for the option between +,-,*,/ and then uses the switch case to implement those operations. \n Note - : you should be able to make this program on your own but even after trying many times if you are unable to implement this program there is a similar program in next section, although try to make it work on your own.
1. Write and Execute a program to build an interactive calculator with the use of functions.
2. Write a function in C that prints all the even numbers between 2 values passed to it.

3. Write a program with a function that checks whether the number sent to it as an argument is negative or positive.
 for ex -:
 input -: -23
 output -: NEGATIVE VALUE
4. Write a program with a function that takes 3 value and returns the biggest value.
5.Write a function that prints the square of first 10 natural numbers.
1.Write a program to input two variables then swap them and print them.(you can use the third/temporary variable for swapping.)
\n2. Write and Execute a program that takes stores address of a variable in a pointer and then add 17 to the value using the pointer.
3.Write a program that takes input of one char,one int and one float and prints the address of each of them.
4.Write and Execute a program that take 2 int as input and after that takes 1 character as input and then swap the two int and prints all the three values finally.
1.Write a program to input two variables then swap(exchange their positions) them using the pointers without using the third variable with the use of a function.
2.Write a program with a function that takes 2 number and returns their product inside a pointer.
3.Write a function that checks a number is prime or not.
4.Write and execute a program with a function that takes three values as pointers and returns a pointer which is the biggest of all three value and then prints the biggest value.
1.Write and execute a program that takes 10 integers as input then adds 10 to all the number and then prints all the 10 integers.

2.Write and execute a program that inputs a string then prints all the even places and odd places/indexes of the string in two separate lines.
 for ex -:
 input - > "HIGHWAY"
 output ->
 "ODD PLACES -: HGWY
 EVEN PLACES -> IHA
3. Write and Execute a program to input full name of a person or a string containing spaces.[Hint -: Use \"%[^\\n]%*c\" instead of %s as this scans whitespaces also]
4.Write and E. a program to input 10 integer values in an array and then print only the even values in it.
1.Write and Execute a program that passes an array to a function using pointers and also pass the length of array then prints all the elements of array from that function.
2.Write and execute a program to dynamically allocate an array of 10 elements using the malloc function then store and print the values in it.

3. W and E a program that inputs an array of 10 elements that and passes the address of that array to a function and then the function will display the values of that array that are at even indices.\n \ti.e. output only a[0],a[2],a[4] ....a[ _even_index_ ].

4. Write and Execute a program that inputs 20 values then takes a value x as input and searches the value x in the array ,if it found the value in it print the (index number+1) which is the position of that value at which the value is found.
1. Make a program to input an array of 3x3 the print the elements of left diagonal and the right diagonal.

2.Write a program that generates an 2D array where first row is filled with the multiples of 2 second row filled with multiples of 9 and third row filled with multiples of 15 and print the array in a matrix format.
3.Write and execute a program that copies all the elements of one 3x3 array a into another 3x3 array b then print b array.
4.Write and execute a program that transposes a given(user input) 3 x 3 matrix. Transposing a matrix means that converting row elements into column elements and vice versa.
1. Write and execute a program that takes name,mail-id and roll number of a student inside a structure and then displays the information.
2. Write and execute a program to input 2 pointer int variables and one int variable with the use of malloc function.
3.Write and execute a program which inputs the name(String format),id(Int format) and address(string format) of 20 students\n and then displays the student name,id and address of all 20 students.

4. Write a program that creates 2 instances of an structure name emp (struct emp1,emp2;) and stores name and id in one structure emp1 and then copy all the data of emp1 to emp2 and display the name and id from emp2.
5. DO the above program but with the use of dynamic memory allocation (struct *emp1,*emp2;). Hint -: see example 2 program above.
1.Write a file handling program to input and save 5 names in a file and then later read the names from the file.
2.Input name and roll number of a student in a file but this time using a structure and then read those name and rollno from the file.
3.Write a file handling program to store and read a paragraph of length 50 to 60 words.
4. Write a file handling program Input name and roll number of 5 students in a file using array and structure and then read those name and rollno from the file.
1.Write a program that uses enums as parameters in while and if-else statement.
2. Write a structure program with the use of Typedef.

Task : This last program is a task for you where you have to learn about goto statement in C and use it to create a program which has a loop using if-else and goto statement without actually using a loop or in otherwords create a conditional loop using goto and if-else.
